intro: Manglietia admirabilis, commonly known as the sacred lily, is a rare and ancient flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Colombia. It belongs to the family Magnoliaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant is known for its fragrant, waxy petals and its ability to thrive in high humidity and shade. Due to its rarity and ecological significance, it is considered an endangered species. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists alike.
